intro: Philammos stevenianus, commonly known as the Steven's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic to many animals, including livestock. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Philammos stevenianus plays an important role in supporting local pollinators, particularly butterflies and bees.
